List data type¶

Bounded lists¶

A bounded list is a list with a known maximal number of elements. The list can be shorter, but can never contain more elements than that maximum size.

The tradeoff for this restriction is that the list does not need to perform any memory allocation for the list’s nodes, which might be faster and fit in tight memory constraints.

Generic Ada Library for Algorithms and Containers (GALAC)
